info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 14 at 11:41PM EDT until June 15 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
FFWAKQ
The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Caroline County in north central Virginia...
* Until 245 AM EDT.
* At 1141 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bowling Green, Milford, Port Royal, Fort Walker, Ladysmith, Villboro, Woodford, Guinea, Rappahannock Academy, Corbin, Nancy Wrights Corner, Cedon and Ruther Glen.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not stay in areas subject to flooding when water begins rising.
Please report flooding by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using X @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
